minijava.parser

Class FileParsingTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • minijava.parser.FileParsingTest

  • public class FileParsingTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Runs the Parser on files from the folder testdata/parser. Files from testdata/parser/ok are expected to produce no syntax error. Files from testdata/parser/error are expected to contain syntax errors.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileParsingTest(java.io.File inputFile, boolean parseSuccessMeansTestPasses)
      Create a new test case (to be called by JUnit, not by you)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object[]> data() 
      void testParser()
      The only test method of this test class: run a fresh parser instance on the input file, and judge the result according to the parseSuccessMeansTestPasses parameter: parseFile error becomes test failure iff parseSuccessMeansTestPasses is true.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileParsingTest

        public FileParsingTest(java.io.File inputFile,
                       boolean parseSuccessMeansTestPasses)
        Create a new test case (to be called by JUnit, not by you)
        Parameters:
        inputFile - the file to parseFile
        parseSuccessMeansTestPasses - true iff you expect the parser to accept it

    • Method Detail

      • testParser

        public void testParser()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        The only test method of this test class: run a fresh parser instance on the input file, and judge the result according to the parseSuccessMeansTestPasses parameter: parseFile error becomes test failure iff parseSuccessMeansTestPasses is true.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file IO goes wrong (shouldn't; but want to know when)
        java.lang.Exception

      • data

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object[]> data()
